a.n: Sarah Vaughan: Jazz from Newport, Brussels 1973

p.k: For the second of two appearances at the 1973 Jazz from Newport Festival in Brussels, Sarah Vaughan and her trio consisting of Carl Schroeder (piano), John Gianelli (bass), and Jimmy Cobb (drums) deliver an excellent set of standards.
p.d: For the second of two appearances at the 1973 Jazz from Newport Festival in Brussels, Sarah Vaughan and her trio consisting of Carl Schroeder (piano), John Gianelli (bass), and Jimmy Cobb (drums) deliver a set of standards that highlights Vaughan's excellent singing in general and her unique take on scat singing in particular. Coming two months after a Japanese tour that resulted in the "Live in Japan" album, Vaughan is heard performing such enduring classics as "I Remember You," "Summertime," and "There Will Never Be Another You" in addition to a humorously improvised version of "Just A Gigolo." For the encore, Sarah herself plays piano on a version of "Body and Soul."
